title: Roundup Owner Bayer Divests Pest-Control Unit in $2.6 Billion Deal
sub_head: Sale marks latest step by the German pharmaceutical company to lower debt as it continues to defend legal claims in the U.S.
body:
BERLINâ€” Bayer AG agreed to sell its pest-control unit to private-equity firm Cinven for $2.6 billion, as the German chemical and drug giant seeks to focus on its core agricultural portfolio and reduce debt.
Environmental Science Professional, a U.S.-based unit of the company, sells pesticides and rodent control to non-farming customers such as warehouses and golf courses. Bayer announced last year its intention to unload the unit, which had around 1 billion euros, equivalent to $1.1 billion, in sales in 2021.
